title: Trump calls Merkel ‘brilliant woman’
text:
German Chancellor Angela Merkel (L) and U.S. President Donald Trump speak during a bilateral meeting in Biarritz, south-west France on August 26, 2019 | Nicholas Kamm/AFP via Getty Images Trump calls Merkel ‘brilliant woman’ US president says he will visit Germany ‘very soon.’

BIARRITZ, France — Donald Trump on Monday praised Angela Merkel, calling her "a brilliant woman" and predicting that the long-standing German chancellor would remain in office for "a long time."

"She is a brilliant woman, and she understands exactly where everything is, she knows it before most people," said Trump, sitting next to Merkel during the public part of a bilateral meeting at the G7 summit in Biarritz.

Trump also said he is planning to "maybe soon" go to Germany for a state visit, before adding that he would "very soon" visit the country. The president said he feels "very honored" by an invitation he had received from Merkel. "I have German in my blood," he said.

Merkel told reporters later that they have not yet agreed "a specific date" for the visit.

The meeting was remarkably relaxed in comparison to previous, often uncomfortable encounters between the two leaders. It stood in a stark contrast to an icy meeting at the D-Day commemorations in England in June, when Trump and Merkel did not even shake hands.

Asked by a reporter whether he was concerned that the club of G7 leaders is going to lose its only female member when Merkel leaves office, Trump replied: "She may surprise you. She may be here a long time, I know well."

"I'm still here," said Merkel, who then giggled.

Even when it came to the tense issue of trade, the atmosphere remained amicable. Trump criticized the EU as "very tough traders," but added: "I don’t hold it against the European Union, I hold it against our presidents and administrations that did not do a good job." Turning to Merkel, he said: "I congratulate you."

The president also said he "hope[s] not" to impose tariffs on European cars — which would be a horror scenario for the German economy that is on the brink of recession — and lauded "some very good discussions going on" on trade.

When Merkel, speaking in German, expressed her "great interest" in enhancing trade relations with the U.S. and said she wanted to reach a transatlantic trade deal "as quickly as possible," Trump joked: "This doesn't sound good."

That caused Merkel to laugh out loud.

After an interpreter translated the chancellor's words, Trump said: "Right, very good."
description: US president says he will visit Germany ‘very soon.’
